question: Compared to the VSI what errors are eliminated by the IVSI?
subject: Navigation

question: What does a vertical speed indicator actually measure?

choices.choice: The rate of temperature and altitude change

subject: Navigation

choices.choice: Produces an output proportional to ambient pressure
Measures the difference between total pressure and static pressure
Measures the difference between the pressure inside and outside a capsule

question: During taxing, VSI shows – 100′. Pilot should

choices.choice: Continue with flight if engineer is on board
Taxi back and VSI should be repaired
Continue with flight with new reference. Error can be correct with an adjusting screw on the front of the instrument

subject: Navigation

question: The vertical speed indicator indications may be in error for some seconds after starting or finishing a climb or descent. The error is a result of:

choices.choice: a combination of time lag and instrument error
a combination of time lag and manoeuvre induced errors.
a combination of position error and manoeuvre induced errors

subject: Navigation

question: If the pilot pipe becomes partly blocked?

choices.choice: The VSI indication will be too low when climbing
The VSI will be too low when descending
The VSI will not be affected

subject: Navigation

question: Entering ground effect is likely is?

choices.choice: Decrease static pressure but increase pilot pressure
Decrease pilot pressure but increase static pressure
Increase position errors. After some time pressure will equalize in capsule and sealed casing. It will show zero in level, climb and descend

subject: Navigation

question: A/C fitted with IVSI will have

choices.choice: Will show correct during turns: Drawbacks: (i) It shows climb during turn (ii) During turbulence it shows oscillation

subject: Navigation

question: If metered orifice in VSI becomes partly blocked, VSI indication will be:
subject: Navigation

question: If casing of VSI in an unpressurized a/c develops a leak.

choices.choice: It will read zero. If there is a leak, pressure will quickly equalize with atmospheric pressure in the capsule, so, difference is zero.

subject: Navigation

question: The corrected action to be taken when the static vent blocks on an unpressurised aircraft is to?
subject: Navigation

question: The vertical speed indicator of an aircraft flying at a true airspeed of 100kt, in a descent with a slope of 3 degrees, indicates:
subject: Navigation

question: IVSI is more useful over normal VSI as its indications are:

choices.choice: More reliable when a/c intimates climb/descend
Reliable at all times. During turns the piston is pulled out because of centrifugal force and the capsule contracts

subject: Navigation

question: If the static vent becomes blocked during climb:

choices.choice: the VSI will indicate an increasing rate of climb
the VSI will indicate a decreasing rate of climb
the VSI will return to zero

subject: Navigation

question: If the casing of VSI in a pressurized a/c develops a leak, VSI indications will be

choices.choice: Too low when climbing or descending
Too high when climbing or descending

Too high when climbing and too low when descending. In pressurized a/c, there is extra pressure coming in the static chamber. So, the capsule will contract and it will show rate of climb very high. This extra pressure will also effect rate of descend, which will be shown too low because of extra pressure. It will show rate of climb even in level flight

subject: Navigation

question: A VSI indicates increasing ROD by?
subject: Navigation

question: The vertical speed indicator VSI is fed by:
subject: Navigation

question: The response time of a vertical speed detector may be increased by adding a:

choices.choice: correction based on an accelometer sensor

subject: Navigation
